title: Helena Regional Airport
text:
Helena Regional Airport is a public <a href="airport">airport</a> two miles northeast of <a href="Helena%2C%20Montana">Helena</a>, in <a href="Lewis%20and%20Clark%20County%2C%20Montana">Lewis and Clark County</a>, <a href="Montana">Montana</a>, United States. It is owned by the Helena Regional Airport Authority.
The <a href="National%20Plan%20of%20Integrated%20Airport%20Systems">National Plan of Integrated Airport Systems</a> for 2011–2015 <a href="FAA%20airport%20categories">categorized</a> it as a "primary commercial service" airport (more than 10,000 enplanements per year). <a href="Federal%20Aviation%20Administration">Federal Aviation Administration</a> records say the airport had 85,649 passenger boardings (enplanements) in <a href="calendar%20year">calendar year</a> 2008, 88,314 in 2009 and 98,193 in 2010.
Facilities.
Helena Regional Airport covers 1,224 <a href="acre">acre</a>s (495 <a href="hectare">ha</a>) at an <a href="elevation">elevation</a> of 3,877 feet (1,182 m). It has three <a href="asphalt">asphalt</a> <a href="runway">runway</a>s: 9/27 is 9,000 by 150 feet (2,743 x 46 m); 5/23 is 4,644 by 75 feet (1,415 x 23 m); 16/34 is 2,989 by 75 feet (911 x 23 m).
In 2013 the airport had 38,877 aircraft operations, average 106 per day: 68% <a href="general%20aviation">general aviation</a>, 14% military, 14% <a href="air%20taxi">air taxi</a>, and 4% airline. 137 aircraft were then based at the airport: 74% single-engine, 14% multi-engine, 2% jet, 3% <a href="helicopter">helicopter</a>, 2% <a href="ultralight">ultralight</a>, and 5% military.
